messages.title: A Bit About Me
messages.content: I was born and brought up here in the Calder Valley, and live here in the constituency with my wife and baby daughter. I spent many years working for Oxfam, the Child Poverty Action Group and a trade union, and I now work in the health sector. I believe in Labour’s fundamental principles. By working together and pooling our strengths, we can create a better society. The last ten years have seen growing poverty while a very small number of people have got extremely rich. I don’t think this makes for a happier society. We need to look out for each other. We need a voice in Westminster that stands up for our schools, our transport, our businesses and our health service.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The NHS has been there for my family in difficult times, but it’s been starved of money, and hurt by years of creeping privatisation.
We have to turn our back on increasingly casual, precarious work that undermines our dignity, and makes people feel insecure.
Anyone hit by the floods knows the importance of this. We only have one planet, and we have to protect it. My daughter’s generation is relying on us.
Some of the trains on the Calder Valley line are as old as I am. We need long-term planning for Northern railways.
We need proper regional infrastructure development in Calderdale and in Yorkshire. We need a plan to support a ‘green’ economy and jobs in high-tech manufacturing.

community.content: We need proper regional infrastructure development in Calderdale and in Yorkshire. We need a plan to support a ‘green’ economy and jobs in high-tech manufacturing.

contactInformation.address: Calder Valley Labour Office, Trades Club Building, Holme Street, Hebden Bridge, HX7 8EE
